plot an image

Source: R/view_surface.R
plot-methods.Rd

plot an image

# S4 method for SurfaceGeometry,missing
plot(x, vals = NA,
  cmap = gray(seq(0, 1, length.out = 255)), vert_clrs = NULL,
  irange = range(vals), thresh = c(0, 0), alpha = 1,
  specular = "black", bgcol = "lightgray", ...)

Arguments

x

the surface to display
vals

the vector of values at each surface node.
cmap

a color map consisting of a vector of colors in hex format (e.g. gray(n=255))
vert_clrs

vertex colors in hex format
irange

the intensity range indicating the low and high values of the color scale.
thresh

a 2-element vector indicating the lower and upper transparency thresholds.
alpha

the foreground trasnparency, default is 1 (opaque).
bgvol

a background color or vector of colors used to shade the surface.

Contents

  • Arguments
